condition.comment: The Player did not reach Asami at the hospital. The Player hired Capucine Rousseau.
condition.narration: The setting sun peeks from behind the clouds. Droplets drip from tips of tiny roofs. Yuki and Capucine walk down the street.
condition.line: Why sleep for 18 hours after work?
Enjoyable? Staring at the clock from fear of wasted time?
condition.narration: Guitar. In the distance. NoLifeQueen runs to it. Capucine continues to walk. As well, Yuki.
The Cardboard City. A same-gender, sitting on a wet box, plays the guitar. She looks up at her spawn.
Asami shivers. She plucks wrong note after wrong note after wrong note. She stares at Yuki.
condition.line: Did you like the flowers I planted in the front yard?
Please tell me you like them. Please, please, please.

choice.line: So they're good! They're great! They're perfect!
You like it all over your god-damned lids when you coat them in —

condition.line: From two to eight, I sowed those seeds in rows.
I tended every leaf with all my might.
Who is your friend? Please tell me you have friends.
condition.narration: Capucine puts out her hand. Asami bows.
condition.line: So what brings you to this land —
condition.narration: Box breaks and Asami falls and guitar drops on forehead it hurts, Capucine helps Asami up, it still hurts and the box is still broken. More rumbling from the Cardboard City. From there, a box falls. Everyone looks into the distance.
condition.line: The structural integrity of an inhabited cardboard box on a rainy day.
condition.narration: Asami picks up her guitar. She plays. Boxes continue to drop from the tops of the so-called buildings.
condition.line: Why would you be here for that?
Not just some stage musician with a non-medical PhD and play-time lab-coat.
condition.narration: Yuki looks down at the edges of that play-time lab-coat.
condition.line: Isn't it cool, daughter. Isn't it cool.
condition.narration: Asami focuses on her guitar, her downcast eyes shielded by her princess cut. Of the Cardboard City, a manned room falls. She plays a wrong note. A tenanted story falls. She plays a wrong measure. A peopled building falls. She plays a wrong song. To ground the guitar is thrown. To arms with stethoscope, to arms with beeper, to arms with stretcher! Now from the rooms and stories and buildings fall the recession's victims. Asami stands.
condition.line: God's greatest grace is the lonely opus.
That's where you get ultimate creative control.
condition.narration: Capucine backs. So does Yuki.The Player walks them both away from the site. All possible actions are cleared; the only thing the Player may do is leave.The clouds return for round two. Yuki and Capucine leave.
